title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node Overview
content: The **RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node** is an indoor air quality sensor kit. It features measurement of CO2, particulate matter, VOC (volatile organic components), temperature, humidity, and light and has in addition a PIR sensor to detect room occupancy.
parent_content:
The **RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node** is an indoor air quality sensor kit. It features measurement of CO2, particulate matter, VOC (volatile organic components), temperature, humidity, and light and has in addition a PIR sensor to detect room occupancy.  
It is a feature-packed air quality sensing device for application development. This device can be used as a quick prototyping tool for Internet-of-Things (IoT) and LoRaWAN Integration. The Indoor Comfort Node comes with an open-source firmware that covers all sensors and functionality. If this firmware doesn't cover your needs, you can use it as a base to develop your firmware.

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node Overview
content: It is a feature-packed air quality sensing device for application development. This device can be used as a quick prototyping tool for Internet-of-Things (IoT) and LoRaWAN Integration. The Indoor Comfort Node comes with an open-source firmware that covers all sensors and functionality. If this firmware doesn't cover your needs, you can use it as a base to develop your firmware.
parent_content:
The **RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node** is an indoor air quality sensor kit. It features measurement of CO2, particulate matter, VOC (volatile organic components), temperature, humidity, and light and has in addition a PIR sensor to detect room occupancy.  
It is a feature-packed air quality sensing device for application development. This device can be used as a quick prototyping tool for Internet-of-Things (IoT) and LoRaWAN Integration. The Indoor Comfort Node comes with an open-source firmware that covers all sensors and functionality. If this firmware doesn't cover your needs, you can use it as a base to develop your firmware.

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node Hardware Overview
content: The hardware of the RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node is built with a custom Base Board (RAK19024) with integrated RAK4630, a custom WisBlock Module carrier (RAK13013) and several WisBlock Sensor and IO modules.
parent_content: The hardware of the RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node is built with a custom Base Board (RAK19024) with integrated RAK4630, a custom WisBlock Module carrier (RAK13013) and several WisBlock Sensor and IO modules.

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Interfaces > RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node Interface Options [TABLE]
content:
The RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node has multiple interface options:  
- USB interface
- UART pin header
- I2C pin header
- SWD/JLink header
- 5-24V supply connector
- Reset button  
> **Image:** RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node Interfaces
parent_content:
The RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node has multiple interface options:  
- USB interface
- UART pin header
- I2C pin header
- SWD/JLink header
- 5-24V supply connector
- Reset button  
> **Image:** RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node Interfaces

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > USB Interface > RAK10702 USB Type C Connector Specifications
content:
Standard USB Type C connector, only USB serial and power supply supported.  
> **Image:** RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node UART
parent_content:

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > UART Pin Header > RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node UART Pin Header [TABLE]
content:
The UART pin header allows to connect to the RAK4630 module for debugging purposes or to connect additional modules with a 3.3V UART interface:  
> **Image:** RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node UART  
| Pin | Pin Name | Description                                                           |
| --- | -------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 1   | Unused   | -                                                                     |
parent_content:
The UART pin header allows to connect to the RAK4630 module for debugging purposes or to connect additional modules with a 3.3V UART interface:  
> **Image:** RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node UART  
| Pin | Pin Name | Description                                                           |
| --- | -------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 1   | Unused   | -                                                                     |
| 2   | GND      | Ground connection                                                     |
| 3   | TX       | data transmit, max 3.3V, connected to P0.16/UART2_TX of RAK4630 |
| 4   | RX       | data receive, max 3.3V, connected to P0.15/UART2_RX of RAK4630  |

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > I2C Pin Header > RAK10702 I2C Pin Header Pinout [TABLE]
content:
The I2C pin header allows to connection of external I2C devices to the RAK10702. The pinout is compatible with the WisBlock Base Boards:  
> **Image:** RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node I2C  
| Pin | Pin Name | Description                                                  |
| --- | -------- | ------------------------------------------------------------ |
| 1   | VCC      | 3.3V output                                            |
parent_content:
The I2C pin header allows to connection of external I2C devices to the RAK10702. The pinout is compatible with the WisBlock Base Boards:  
> **Image:** RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node I2C  
| Pin | Pin Name | Description                                                  |
| --- | -------- | ------------------------------------------------------------ |
| 1   | VCC      | 3.3V output                                            |
| 2   | GND      | Ground connection                                            |
| 3   | SCL      | clock, max 3.3V, connected to P0.14/I2C_SCL of RAK4630 |
| 4   | SDA      | data, max 3.3V, connected to P0.13/I2C_SCL of RAK4630  |

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > SWD/Jlink Pin Header > RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node SWD Pin Header [TABLE]

| 2   | IO       | SWDIO data transmission                        |
| 3   | CLK      | SWCLK clock                                    |
| 4   | GND      | Ground connection                              |
| 5   | RESET    | MCU reset connection                           |

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > 5-24V Supply Connector > RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node Power Supply Connector [TABLE]
content:
The 5-24 V supply connector is for the power supply of the RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node:  
> **Image:** RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node Supply  
| Pin | Pin Name | Description       |
| --- | -------- | ----------------- |
| 1   | VCC      | 5-24V input       |
| 2   | GND      | Ground connection |  
> **WARNING:** When connecting an external supply, make sure  
- The voltage is not below 5V or exceeds 24V in any case (including voltage spikes)

| 1   | VCC      | 5-24V input       |
| 2   | GND      | Ground connection |  
> **WARNING:** When connecting an external supply, make sure  
- The voltage is not below 5V or exceeds 24V in any case (including voltage spikes)
- The polarity of the connection is correct

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > RF Characteristics > Operating Frequencies > RAK4630 LoRaWAN Frequency Bands for RAK10702 [TABLE]
content:
The RAK4630 module used in the RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node supports the LoRaWAN bands shown in the table below.  
| Region        | Frequency (MHz) |
| ------------- | --------------- |
| Russia        | RU864           |
| India         | IN865           |
| Europe        | EU868           |
| North America | US915           |
| Canada        | US915           |
| Australia     | AU915           |
| Korea         | KR920           |
| Asia          | AS923-1/2/3     |

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Electrical Characteristics > Power Supply > RAK10702 Power Supply Options and Warnings
content:
The RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node can be supplied with a DC voltage from 5 to 24 V through the screw terminal. Alternatively, the device can be supplied through the USB connector.  
> **Image:** Power supply connector  
> **WARNING:** When connecting an external supply, make sure  
- the voltage is not below 5V or exceeds 24V in any case (including voltage spikes)
- the polarity of the connection is correct

- the voltage is not below 5V or exceeds 24V in any case (including voltage spikes)
- the polarity of the connection is correct

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Firmware > Flashing the Updated Firmware over USB > Firmware Update Procedure for RAK10702 [CODE]
content:
1. Download the latest firmware to a folder on your computer.
2. Download the firmware update in the same folder.
3. In the same folder, open the command prompt.
4. Connect the WisBlock GNSS Tracker to the computer using USB.
5. Get the COM port the GNSS Tracker is using, for example, COM19.
6. Flash the new firmware with the command **`adafruit-nrfutil dfu serial --package RAK10702-Latest.zip -p COM19 -b 115200`**.
parent_content:
1. Download the latest firmware to a folder on your computer.
2. Download the firmware update in the same folder.
3. In the same folder, open the command prompt.
4. Connect the WisBlock GNSS Tracker to the computer using USB.
5. Get the COM port the GNSS Tracker is using, for example, COM19.
6. Flash the new firmware with the command **`adafruit-nrfutil dfu serial --package RAK10702-Latest.zip -p COM19 -b 115200`**.

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Firmware > Flashing the Updated Firmware Over USB Using the UF2 File > How to Update Firmware on RAK10702
content:
1. Download the [latest UF2 firmware file](https://downloads.rakwireless.com/LoRa/WisBlock/Solutions/RAK10702-Latest-UF2.zip) to your computer. You must extract `RAK10702-Latest-UF2.uf2` from this zip file.
2. Connect the RAK10702 to the computer using USB.
3. Press the reset button twice.
4. There should be a new USB drive named `RAK4631` on your computer after double-clicking on reset.
parent_content:
1. Download the [latest UF2 firmware file](https://downloads.rakwireless.com/LoRa/WisBlock/Solutions/RAK10702-Latest-UF2.zip) to your computer. You must extract `RAK10702-Latest-UF2.uf2` from this zip file.
2. Connect the RAK10702 to the computer using USB.
3. Press the reset button twice.
4. There should be a new USB drive named `RAK4631` on your computer after double-clicking on reset.
5. Open this drive and drag the extracted UF2 file `RAK10702-Latest.uf2` to that USB drive. It will overwrite the `CURRENT.UF2` file and automatically reset the RAK4631 module in the RAK10702.
6. After reset, the tracker has the updated firmware uploaded.

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Firmware > Flashing the Updated Firmware Over USB Using the UF2 File > How to Update Firmware on RAK10702
content:
4. There should be a new USB drive named `RAK4631` on your computer after double-clicking on reset.
5. Open this drive and drag the extracted UF2 file `RAK10702-Latest.uf2` to that USB drive. It will overwrite the `CURRENT.UF2` file and automatically reset the RAK4631 module in the RAK10702.
6. After reset, the tracker has the updated firmware uploaded.
parent_content:
1. Download the [latest UF2 firmware file](https://downloads.rakwireless.com/LoRa/WisBlock/Solutions/RAK10702-Latest-UF2.zip) to your computer. You must extract `RAK10702-Latest-UF2.uf2` from this zip file.
2. Connect the RAK10702 to the computer using USB.
3. Press the reset button twice.
4. There should be a new USB drive named `RAK4631` on your computer after double-clicking on reset.
5. Open this drive and drag the extracted UF2 file `RAK10702-Latest.uf2` to that USB drive. It will overwrite the `CURRENT.UF2` file and automatically reset the RAK4631 module in the RAK10702.
6. After reset, the tracker has the updated firmware uploaded.

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Firmware > Flashing the Updated Firmware Over BLE > Using WisBlock Toolbox (Android Only) > How to Update Firmware on RAK10702 Using WisBlock Toolbox
content:
1. Download the latest firmware into a folder on your computer.
2. Copy the firmware into a folder on your Android phone.
3. Install [WisBlock Toolbox](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=tk.giesecke.wisblock_toolbox) on your Android phone.
4. In the WisBlock Toolbox, open the DFU application.
5. Connect over BLE to the GNSS Tracker.
6. Select the firmware file on the Android device.
7. Push **UPLOAD** to start flashing the new firmware.
parent_content:
1. Download the latest firmware into a folder on your computer.
2. Copy the firmware into a folder on your Android phone.
3. Install [WisBlock Toolbox](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=tk.giesecke.wisblock_toolbox) on your Android phone.
4. In the WisBlock Toolbox, open the DFU application.
5. Connect over BLE to the GNSS Tracker.
6. Select the firmware file on the Android device.
7. Push **UPLOAD** to start flashing the new firmware.

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Firmware > Flashing the Updated Firmware Over BLE > Using nRF Connect (Available for Android and iOS) > Firmware Update Procedure for RAK10702 GNSS Tracker
content:
1. Download the latest firmware into a folder on your computer.
2. Copy the firmware into a folder on your Android phone.
3. Install the nRF Connect on your phone.
- Android [nRF Connect](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=no.nordicsemi.android.mcp)
- iOS [nRF Connect](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/nrf-connect-for-mobile/id1054362403)
4. In the nRF Connect, connect to the GNSS Tracker.
5. Click the **DFU** button in the top right of the screen.
parent_content:
1. Download the latest firmware into a folder on your computer.
2. Copy the firmware into a folder on your Android phone.
3. Install the nRF Connect on your phone.
- Android [nRF Connect](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=no.nordicsemi.android.mcp)
- iOS [nRF Connect](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/nrf-connect-for-mobile/id1054362403)
4. In the nRF Connect, connect to the GNSS Tracker.
5. Click the **DFU** button in the top right of the screen.
6. Select the firmware file on the Android device.
7. The upload will start automatically.

7. The upload will start automatically.

title: RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > RAK10702 Indoor Comfort Node Datasheet > Specifications > Firmware > Flashing the Updated Firmware Over BLE > Creating Your Own RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node Firmware > Building RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node Firmware
content: Build your own RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node firmware with our open-source code available on the [Github Repo](https://github.com/RAKWireless/RAK10702-Indoor-Comfort). The project structure is for PlatformIO. If you need to use ArduinoIDE, you must rename the file app.cpp to an .INO file to be able to load the file in ArduinoIDE.
parent_content:
Build your own RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node firmware with our open-source code available on the [Github Repo](https://github.com/RAKWireless/RAK10702-Indoor-Comfort). The project structure is for PlatformIO. If you need to use ArduinoIDE, you must rename the file app.cpp to an .INO file to be able to load the file in ArduinoIDE.  
You can extend the functionality of the RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node by using these sources. You can write, as well, your own RAK10702 WisBlock Indoor Comfort Node application based on these sources.
